answers.answer: Pro bono legal help is available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The 'Lawyers for refugees' campaign by the National Association of the Romanian Bars provides free legal and humanitarian assistance for Ukrainian refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Lawyers for refugees'.

answers.answer: UA.SUPPORT matches Ukrainian refugees seeking legal help of any kind with lawyers willing to offer support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'UA.SUPPORT'.

answers.answer: ACTEDO provides legal assistance to refugees for problems such as obtaining refugee status or resolving various civil or administrative legal issues encountered during their stay in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'ACTEDO'.

answers.answer: Individuals can access the UNHCR phone list of lawyers who help refugees by scanning the QR code provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Phone list of lawyers from UNHCR who help refugees'.

answers.answer: CNRR's free legal counseling service can be contacted directly through their dedicated hotline: +40730073170, and is also accessible via WhatsApp, Telegram, and Viber.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: The operating hours for CNRR's legal counseling hotline are Monday to Friday, from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers'.
